text:
Hi there Jess, sorry for taking that long to reply. Things are indeed hectic, despite everyone being stuck home. I myself am very anxious here with it all. Sorry to hear your partner was hospitalised. How is it going now? Hope you're both fine.
I didn't realise you had studied animation, sorry, your profile I got didn't mention it.

The industry does beat you down often, even when you're working in it. From my point of view, especially now with Brexit and even more with isolation we tend to feel helpless. 
There's a lot of productions in the UK though. Not as many in TV series as there seems to be in Ireland, but if you're ok with moving, I think there's going to be a lot going on in those 2 countries for a while, not to mention the rest of Europe, but Ireland is one of the most active and varied market for TV animation around here. 
But I would like to stay in the UK and hope for local productions, if that's your case too

I came from Brazil to work on It's Pony and that wasa huge move, I brought my family and we intend to stay here.
Production is ending next month, and although it was nice to work in and colleagues are great, the overall production isn't very different in terms of organisation and methodology from what I was used to, and I hadn't expected that

Like you said, productions are far between, if I get it right. If you mean there's usually a gap between jobs and also the change of cities.
Right now I'm considering moving cities because of work. 1 month to the end of production and I still don't know if they'll extend the contracts, so it's been months I have been looking for other jobs.

I haven't freelanced In the UK, but commercial jobs are different than TV series work. It tends to be less toxic on the long run and its way more varied and diverse. You get to do a lot of different styles in a given timeframe, and it pays way more proportionally

I'd love to see your work, if you could share of it. What have you done illustrations for? 
What's the style and type of work you enjoy most?
Please feel free to ask about specific topics you'd like to chat!
Cheers
I just looked up Instagram, is @jessbernadetteart you?
